alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Imperial Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 06 at 5:22PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Imperial County through 600 PM PDT... At 522 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Brawley, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brawley, Imperial, Holtville, Glamis, Alamorio and Wiest. This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 44 and 53. CA Route 78 between mile markers 14 and 40. CA Route 111 between mile markers 10 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Imperial Valley
